version_description:
- 10 Pin Shuffle is now iOS 8 compliant!
- Minor bug fixes

1) When playing a multiplayer peer-to-peer game of 10 Pin Poker, Player 2's cards were displayed on top of Player 1's.
2) You can now use your iPhone, iPod touch or iPad as a second controller in 2 player games on Apple TV.
3) Frame rate has increased to a silky smooth 60fps on newer devices (iPhone 4s, iPad 2, iPod touch 5th gen and newer).
4) Scores and statistics are now synchronized between all your devices using the iCloud.
5) Changed the appearance of the standard white iOS 7+ message boxes.
6) iOS 9 compatible.

If you've reviewed or rated a previous version of 10 Pin Shuffle then please take a few seconds to re-send it as ratings are reset with each new update. You won't need to re-write your review, you just need to rate this new version and press the send button again on the App Store review page. Thanks!

1) Added high definition retina images to all the "How to Play" and "Game Controls" help pages.
2) Minor bug fixes.

Bluetooth multiplayer was crashing when you tried to join a Peer-to-Peer game on iOS 10

1) You can now play a Peer-to-Peer multiplayer game against an Android device running 10 Pin Shuffle Pro 2.00 or higher (Local Wi-Fi only, not Bluetooth).
2) Bowling replays now feature slow motion effects.
3) Table wood frame is shinier.

Bug Fixes in v2.00

1) The sound of the puck sliding on the table would sometimes crackle when you dragged it around while aiming.

1) Some people reported that the game was harder to play in the v2.00 update so a minor physics tweak has been reverted and things should now play as before.
2) Peer-to-Peer multiplayer games against Android devices are now more reliable (make sure both devices are using version 2.01)
3) The size of the Apple TV virtual remote control was too big on 5.5" Plus phones making it difficult to control the puck.
4) The crowd was cheering during the winner's podium sequence even when sound effects were turned off.

1) Now fills the entire screen on the iPhone X.
2) You can tap the screen to skip replays and Strike/Spare/Turkey animations.
3) Added a volume slider to the Pause screen so you can change the sound effects volume while playing a game.
4) New look to the bowling pins with gold base and new artwork.
5) Smoother game frame rate.

Bug Fixes in v2.20

1) If you switched Apps or put the device to sleep during the Strike animation then when you returned to the App, the puck for the next shot would hang in the air and not drop to the table.
2) The sound effects volume may have always been set to the maximum each time the App launched.
3) We've turned off the annoying sounds that play during Splits. You can turn them on or off from the Settings screen.
4) The opponents that you'd unlocked on one device weren't synchronizing with your other devices via the iCloud.

1) All devices display in their native screen resolution now. This mainly affects the larger screen iPhone Plus devices.
2) You can now choose whether you shoot first or second against a Bowling CPU opponent.

1) All devices display in their native screen resolution now. This mainly affects the larger screen iPhone Plus devices.
2) You can now choose whether you shoot first or second against a Bowling CPU opponent.

Bug Fixes in 2.31

1) Sometimes the game would crash when the cards were shown at the end of a game of Poker.
2) If you scored a Strike in Poker with 4 cards showing and then tapped on the empty space where the 5th card should be then the game would crash.
3) If you put the app into the background during game play and then opened the app again then the screen wouldn’t update.
4) The in-game store where you acquire gold shuffleboard pucks would crash when the language was set to Japanese.
5) There was a visible glitch at the end of each player’s turn during a Peer-to-Peer multiplayer game.
Minor bug fixes, mainly to do with UI positioning on some iPhone models.
The puck wouldn't swipe properly on some devices.

1) The game would freeze and not accept input on iPhone 12, 13 and newer iPads when running iOS 15.
2) Buttons and other UI now correctly positioned on all iPads (the main culprits were 12.9 inch iPads, latest iPad Air and other non standard pixel sized iPads.
3) Dark mode made certain screens look bad so the backgrounds are now always white instead of black.
